Collapse to String

Collapse to String

collapseToString(object, ...)

# S4 method for character
collapseToString(object, sep = ", ", unique = TRUE,
  sort = TRUE, keepNA = FALSE, ...)

# S4 method for integer
collapseToString(object, sep = ", ", unique = TRUE,
  sort = TRUE, keepNA = FALSE, ...)

# S4 method for data.frame
collapseToString(object, sep = ", ", unique = TRUE,
  sort = TRUE, keepNA = FALSE, ...)

# S4 method for DataFrame
collapseToString(object, sep = ", ", unique = TRUE,
  sort = TRUE, keepNA = FALSE, ...)

# S4 method for matrix
collapseToString(object, sep = ", ", unique = TRUE,
  sort = TRUE, keepNA = FALSE, ...)

# S4 method for tbl_df
collapseToString(object, sep = ", ", unique = TRUE,
  sort = TRUE, keepNA = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

object

Object.
...

Additional arguments, passed to glue::collapse().
sep

Separator. Defaults to comma.
unique

Unique values.
sort

Sort values.
keepNA

Keep NA values.

Value

  • For vector: String.

  • For column data: Single row.

See also

  • base::toString().

  • glue::collapse().

Examples

# Designed primarily for `dims` objects
mtcars %>%
    head() %>%
    collapseToString() %>%
    t()
#>      [,1]                                  
#> mpg  "18.1, 18.7, 21, 21.4, 22.8"          
#> cyl  "4, 6, 8"                             
#> disp "108, 160, 225, 258, 360"             
#> hp   "105, 110, 175, 93"                   
#> drat "2.76, 3.08, 3.15, 3.85, 3.9"         
#> wt   "2.32, 2.62, 2.875, 3.215, 3.44, 3.46"
#> qsec "16.46, 17.02, 18.61, 19.44, 20.22"   
#> vs   "0, 1"                                
#> am   "0, 1"                                
#> gear "3, 4"                                
#> carb "1, 2, 4"                             

# Vectors are also supported
groceries <- c("milk", "eggs", "eggs", "veggies", NA)
collapseToString(groceries)
#> eggs, milk, veggies
collapseToString(groceries, unique = FALSE, sort = FALSE)
#> milk, eggs, eggs, veggies
